title: water managment
content:
I'll guide you through the solution.

Step 1: Selecting Indicators for Irrigation Performance Assessment To evaluate the irrigation performance of the scheme and commercial farmers, I recommend the following six indicators:

1. Water Use Efficiency (WUE): Measures the amount of crop produced per unit of water used. 2. Irrigation Efficiency (IE): Evaluates the proportion of water supplied that is actually used by the crop. 3. Crop Water Productivity (CWP): Assesses the amount of crop produced per unit of water consumed. 4. Relative Water Supply (RWS): Compares the actual water supply to the potential crop water requirement. 5. Cropped Area Ratio (CAR): Measures the proportion of the command area that is actually cropped. 6. Yield Gap (YG): Evaluates the difference between the actual and potential crop yields.

Step 2: Computing the Indicators Season 1: 1. WUE: 3 tons / (100 mm + 470 mm - 70 mm) = 3 tons / 500 mm = 0.006 tons/mm 2. IE: (100 mm + 70 mm) / 100 mm = 1.7 (approx.) 3. CWP: 3 tons / (100 mm + 470 mm - 70 mm) = 3 tons / 500 mm = 0.006 tons/mm 4. RWS: (100 mm + 470 mm - 70 mm) / 480 mm = 1.02 (approx.) 5. CAR: 80 ha / 100 ha = 0.8 6. YG: (3 tons - 3 tons) / 3 tons = 0 (no yield gap)

Season 2: 1. WUE: 2 tons / (100 mm + 350 mm - 70 mm) = 2 tons / 380 mm = 0.0053 tons/mm 2. IE: (100 mm + 70 mm) / 100 mm = 1.7 (approx.) 3. CWP: 2 tons / (100 mm + 350 mm - 70 mm) = 2 tons / 380 mm = 0.0053 tons/mm 4. RWS: (100 mm + 350 mm - 70 mm) / 600 mm = 0.63 (approx.) 5. CAR: 50 ha / 100 ha = 0.5 6. YG: (2 tons - 3 tons) / 3 tons = -0.33 (yield gap of 33%)

Step 3: Commenting on the Performance of the Irrigation Scheme Based on the indicators:

- WUE and CWP are relatively low, indicating room for improvement in water use efficiency. - IE is high, suggesting that the irrigation system is efficient in delivering water to the crop. - RWS is near optimal in Season 1 but lower in Season 2, indicating a potential water supply issue. - CAR is lower in Season 2, indicating underutilization of the command area. - YG shows a significant yield gap in Season 2, indicating potential for yield improvement.

Step 4: Management Actions to Improve Performance 1. Improve WUE and CWP: Implement water-saving technologies, optimize irrigation scheduling, and promote crop varieties with improved water use efficiency. 2. Maintain IE: Regularly inspect and maintain the irrigation system to ensure efficient water delivery. 3. Address RWS: Investigate water supply issues and explore alternative water sources or storage options. 4. Increase CAR: Encourage farmers to cultivate more area within the command area. 5. Close YG: Provide training on best agricultural practices, soil management, and fertilizer application to improve crop yields.

By addressing these areas, the irrigation scheme can improve its performance, increase crop yields, and optimize water use.
creator: evansmazulu

title: Is there a current working Ad blocker for You tube?

title: Endless crashes
content:
I have Firefox on two separate computers, a desktop running Win7Prof64bit and a laptop running Win10Pro 64bit. Both Firefox installations crash constantly, ie every 10 - 15 mins. They show the "Gah! Firefox just crashed. Please tell us what you were doing", and the box to return the data to Mozilla. With Restore This Tab at the bottom.

I always send you these reports but in about a year, the problem remains the same. Nothing has improved, I never hear back from you. Two different PCs, two different OSs, constant reports, no improvement. Why do I never hear from you? Why does this problem continue endlessly? I'm wasting my time sending you the reports. You take no notice. If you do, why does the problem continue and why do I never hear from you?

introduzco las direcciones de sitios web con el estado "permitir".
